Package controller

Class MainMenuController

java.lang.Object
controller.MainMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainMenuController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for the main menu.

  • Method Details

    • onMouseClickedAll

      void onMouseClickedAll(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method sets the appointment tableview to display all appointments.
      Parameters:
      event - All Appointments button clicked.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onMouseClickedMonth

      void onMouseClickedMonth(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method sets the appointment tableview to display all appointments from this month. It gets all appointments and goes through each one to see if it starts this month this year.
      Parameters:
      event - This Month button clicked.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onMouseClickedWeek

      void onMouseClickedWeek(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method sets the appointment tableview to display all appointments from this week. It gets all appointments and then goes through each one to see if it starts this week.
      Parameters:
      event - This Week button clicked.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onActionCreateAppointment

      void onActionCreateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the create appointment screen. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Create(appointment) button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionCreateCustomer

      void onActionCreateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the create customer screen. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Create(customer) button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionDeleteAppointment

      void onActionDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method deletes the selected appointment from the appointment tableview. First, it alerts the user if an appointment is not selected. If one is selected, it confirms whether or not the user would like to delete it. Finally, it attempts to delete the appointment and then alerts the user of the outcome. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Create(appointment) button clicked.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws SQLException
      This method deletes the selected customer from the customer tableview. First, it alerts the user if a customer is not selected. If one is selected, it confirms whether or not the user would like to delete the customer. Finally, it attempts to delete the customer and then alerts the user of the outcome. Any appointments in the appointment tableview for this customer will also be deleted. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Create(customer) button clicked.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • onActionLogOut

      void onActionLogOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the login screen. It also sets the loggedIn boolean to false. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Logout button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionReports

      void onActionReports(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the reports screen. It utilizes the sceneChange lambda expression.
      Parameters:
      event - Reports button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionUpdateAppointment

      void onActionUpdateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the update appointment screen with the information of the selected appointment in the appointments tableview. First, it alerts the user if there is no selected appointment. If an appointment is selected, the appointment is passed to the UpdateAppointmentController. Finally, the update appointment screen is loaded.
      Parameters:
      event - Update(appointment) button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onActionUpdateCustomer

      void onActionUpdateCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method loads the update customer screen with the information of the selected customer in the customers tableview. First, it alerts the user if there is no selected customer. If a customer is selected, the customer is passed to the UpdateCustomerController. Finally, the update customer screen is loaded.
      Parameters:
      event - Update(customer) button clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sendMsg

      public void sendMsg(String msg)
      This method displays a message from a controller class.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be displayed below the appointments tableview

    • sendMsg1

      public void sendMsg1(String msg)
      This method displays a message from a controller class.
      Parameters:
      msg - The message to be displayed below the customers tableview

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      This method initializes the main menu controller class. It sets the items in the customers and appointments tableviews. It also alerts the user if there is an ongoing or upcoming appointment.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - file path
      rb - null
